messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I’d be glad to pull that up, but could you clarify a couple of things for me?
• By “yesterday,” do you mean reminders that were scheduled to trigger yesterday, or reminders you created yesterday?  
• What time zone should I use to determine what counts as “yesterday”?
I mean the reminder that was scheduled for yesterday. For the time zone, use the default one on your device.

To make sure I grab exactly the reminders that were scheduled for “yesterday” in your local time, could you tell me today’s date (or the current date-and-time) on your device? That will let me define the right 24-hour window.
Sorry, I don't know today's date. Can you figure it out?

To pull the “yesterday” reminder, I still need a reference point for what your device thinks “today” is. Could you quickly glance at the clock or calendar on your phone/computer and tell me the current date (or even just the month and day) it shows? That one detail will let me grab the right 24-hour window.
Can you enable whatever you need to gather the current date?

I’m sorry—I don’t have permission to read the clock on your device, so I still need you to tell me what date your device shows as “today.” Even just the month and day (for example, “June 24”) would be enough for me to identify yesterday’s 24-hour window and fetch the correct reminder.
